title: VP, Consulting - Virtual
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
Diversified continues to expand our thought leadership team to grow our Consulting practice further, encompassing a larger focus across our company’s business units of Media and Workplace with the addition of a Vice President of Consulting.
  
We are seeking a Vice President of Consulting, to spearhead our Consulting practice across Media and Workplace verticals. This executive role is pivotal in leading a team of consultants and subject matter experts, driving excellence in thought leadership, customer service, and business acumen. The Vice President, Consulting, will be instrumental in shaping the strategic direction of the consulting division, ensuring the delivery of high-value, outcome focused solutions to our clients, and fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
  
The Consulting team is staffed with, among other roles, Principal Consultants across multiple disciplines inclusive of transformation efforts, Media supply chain initiatives, and Experiential Workplace solutions. These consultants serve as lead advisors for key/enterprise clients and strategic projects. The VP of Consulting is responsible, at an executive level, for the overarching deliverables supporting the decisions and recommendations made within the team, inclusive of the team itself and their activities.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* The VP of Consulting is a senior leadr within the Consulting staff and offers top down expertise, resources, and guidance to help our clients succeed in their industry. As a VP of Consulting, you may specialize in a variety of technologies/practice areas, and your duties include:
* Provide visionary leadership for the Consulting practice, setting strategic goals and driving business growth across Media and Workplace sectors.
* Lead, mentor, and expand a team of consultants and subject matter experts, fostering an environment of professional development and excellence.
* Oversee the sales process, from lead generation to deal closure, ensuring a high standard of customer service and satisfaction.
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with key clients and business partners, understanding their business needs and delivering tailored consulting solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of consulting services with One Diversified's broader offerings.
* Drive thought leadership in the industry, representing the company at conferences, panels, and networking events.
* Ensure the consulting practice's offerings remain at the forefront of industry trends and technological advancements.
* Report to the Senior Vice President of Consulting, providing regular updates on practice performance, market opportunities, and strategic initiatives.


You should expect to work, both in a leadership and supporting function, on several projects across multiple clients as you immerse yourself in their business imperatives and processes, advise on business strategy and tactics, and provide vision and direction for the team.
  
You are responsible for the leadership and ultimate execution of the engagement deliverables, which will follow Diversified’s highest standards for quality and presentation with C-Level caliber collateral.
  
Ideally, You will maintain a subject matter expert role versed in a variety of technologies, including intimate knowledge of vendor product offerings, and a firm perspective on the competitive landscape. Additionally, you will serve as an industry evangelist representing Diversified at global technology conferences, customer engagements and publications in both print and online.
  
  

**Other duties will include:**  

* Develop deep working relationships with Senior Executives and Senior Managers across the client account teams.
* Understand the business direction of clients, Building knowledge capital through research and development, leveraging industry insights to deliver best of breed solutions to clients.
* Helping grow consulting Globally through thought leadership and entrepreneurialism.
* Function as the main contact between Diversified and client from beginning to end of a project/engagement ensuring the team meets the client's needs.
* Develop relationships throughout the customer's organization to identify new business opportunities.
* Participate with Sales during the sales process through scoping workshops, presentations, solutions, development of SOW's.
* Provide the bridge between Sales and Professional Services as new opportunities are closed.
* Create an environment where others feel it is safe to be open and candid, and where conflicting ideas and opinions are regularly discussed.
* Participate in projects involving strategy, implementation support, and optimization related to digital solutions media supply chain.
* Responsible to collaborate on the creation of project deliverables inclusive of the recommendations of technology, Bills of Materials, design concepts and deployment strategies, and quoting and support in vendor negotiations


**Complexity:**  

Highly Complex; The Principal Consultant needs to be able to assimilate complex areas of technology to conceptualize and communicate these to customers at the highest level.
  
  

**Decision Making Authority:**  

The Principal Consultant role reports to the Head of the Consulting department and will direct teams of other consultants, solutions architects along with vendors and customers throughout an engagement lifecycle. They will work with the Diversified account executives to make informed business decisions that will benefit the customer’s desired outcome.
  
  

**Physical Working Environment:**  

Limited physical labor required; most work will be performed on a computer. Remote or On-Site. Up to 50% travel may be expected.
  
What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* 4-year degree in a relevant business / technology field of study or equivalent experience.
* Experienced with technology and business operations and strategies relevant to the production, processing and distribution of audiovisual content for a variety of industries, including media, financial, retail, etc.


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* You are an undisputed expert in your field(s) of technology and business, with 10+ years of experience as a solutions architect/engineer and trusted customer advisor.
* Your educational and professional background is varied and multifaceted and has equipped you with a broad perspective on business and technology, rooted in practical work as an engineer, solution sales professional, or other customer-facing roles.
* You are skilled at problem-solving, identifying issues, and conceptualizing solutions and you’re able to articulate a clear roadmap for implementing those solutions.
* As a Principal Consultant, you may be responsible for multiple projects at the same time, so it is necessary to have strong organizational skills that enable you to manage your time and responsibilities effectively and efficiently. Your organizational skills will also be required to keep track of client information, project details and other important data.
* You are able to manage time to plan and execute tasks effectively and efficiently within a set time frame for yourself and others to manage your own workload and that of your team members, ensuring that tasks are completed on time.
* You are trained, certified or deeply experienced in working with many of the following platforms: Platforms for compute, storage, orchestration and media processing, including AWS, Azure, Google, SAN/NAS, Object Storage (cloud/remote/on-premises), transcoding (Vantage, Elemental), MAMs (Iconik, CatDV, Dalet Flex, Vidispine, Avid MediaCentral/Interplay), Editorial, (Avid, Adobe, Apple, DaVinci), Cloud/hybrid Workflow, Remote workflow (Teradici, BeBop, etc.) and Virtualization Platforms (VMWare ESXi), as well as other media-related systems and solutions
* You have an in-depth understanding of media production, processing and distribution workflows for both live and fille-based content.
* You have excellent communication skills to both listen, understand, and convey important and complex technical information to clients, other consultants and other professionals.
* You are able to communicate effectively with vendors and manufacturers about RFQ technology, pricing and terms.
* You are a highly self-motivated self-starter who can operate independently as well as collaboratively with other Diversified team members to multi-task in an energetic environment.
* Must have the ability to communicate confidently with customers on a 1-on-1 and group setting.
* Must be willing to travel and able to work in a light industrial environment.
* Demonstrated ability to carry out consulting activities, methodologies leading to comprehensive discovery, analysis and technical/business recommendations.
* Advanced communication skills, including business/technical writing and presentations.
* Advanced ability to present in-depth technical solutions
* Self-motivation with the ability to motivate and energize a project team
* Demonstrate ability to work successfully at all customer levels from C-level executives to end users
* Thoughtful leadership and innovative thinking.


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Project Manager, Practice Improvement & Consulting (Integrated Health)
description:
**About Us**


The National Council’s vision is *to make mental wellbeing, including recovery from substance use challenges, a reality for everyone*. Despite an overwhelming need, nearly 30 million people across the US do not have access to comprehensive, high-quality, affordable mental health and substance use care when they need it.


Founded in 1969, the National Council for Mental Wellbeing is a membership organization that drives policy and social change on behalf of nearly 3,200 mental health and substance use treatment organizations and the more than 10 million children, adults, and families they serve. We advocate for policies to ensure equitable access to high-quality services. We build the capacity of mental health and substance use treatment organizations. And we promote a greater understanding of mental wellbeing as a core component of comprehensive health and health care. Through our Mental Health First Aid program, we have trained more than 3 million people in the US to identify, understand and respond to signs and symptoms of mental health and substance use challenges.


The National Council is growing rapidly to meet this moment. Since 2020, our budget ($77M) and the number of passionate staff (250+) have grown more than 50%. In addition, while we maintain office space in Washington, DC, we are a remote-first organization, meaning our employees work remotely from their locations across the United States.


We are an equal-opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and commit ourselves to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.


**Position Summary**  

The Practice Improvement and Consulting Department (PIC) is central to the National Council’s goal of providing timely and meaningful technical assistance and consulting to community mental health and substance use services organizations and others serving the health of our nation. As directed by the Senior Director/Director, PIC, the Project Manager position provides project management support for multiple initiatives to maximize value on consulting engagements, meet client/customer expectations, and support the development of deliverables for the benefit of the mental health and substance use services field. This position assists in the day-to-day operations of the department within the framework of the National Council's strategic goals and priorities.


This is an individual contributor role without direct reports. We seek candidates who are positive, inventive, proactive, and efficient while maintaining an approachable and professional presence to internal and external audiences. While this position can be based remotely anywhere in the United States, our primary work hours are 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM Eastern time zone hours.


**Project Overview**


In this position, you will support the National Council’s Center Of Excellence for Integrated Health Solutions (CoE-IHS), a national training and technical assistance (TTA) center, funded by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Administration (SAMHSA). The CoE-IHS provides extensive TTA driving the advancement of comprehensive and equitable integrated care, and is home of the newest evidence-based resources, tools and consultation for providers, organizations and governments working to integrate primary and behavioral health care. This position is one of two Project Manager positions supporting the CoE-IHS project, and will be responsible for developing, executing, and maintaining workplans and project management systems for specific TTA activities as assigned.


**Responsibilities**  

*PIC Department Activities*


* Develop and monitor work plans for projects of varying sizes and degrees of complexity; work with teams to execute projects and product development
* Monitor project finances, including the development of project budgets, staffing allocations and financial projections
* Manage relationships and collaborate with PIC staff, consultants and subcontractors, other National Council departments and both public/governmental and private external clients/customers
* Create new tools and processes, where needed, to support successful project management
* Manage project data and evaluation activities
* Interact with other team members, including task oversight and delegation, to develop and execute work plans
* Monitor performance and communicate areas of risk and opportunity to the project director and other National Council leadership, where appropriate
* Draft progress reports and other materials that describe project milestones and results
* Develop and/or curate technical assistance and educational resources that benefit the field; includes conducting research, synthesizing information and developing materials tailored to specific audiences
* Facilitate internal and external meetings as needed
* Provide project mentorship to coordinators and interns
* Present during webinars and meetings as needed
* Support proposal and business development efforts as needed


*Organizational Activities*


* Participate in department, project and all staff meetings
* Travel on behalf of the National Council as needed
* Carry out other duties as assigned


**Required Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree with 4-6 years of project management experience, or Master's degree with 2-4 years of experience
* Background in public health, mental health and substance use services or related fields is desirable
* Experience supporting grants or contracts oversight, including budget, resource, task, and timeline management
* Process-oriented ability to identify areas for continuous quality improvement and manage solutions implementation
* Experience with in-person and virtual meeting planning and coordination
* High-level proficiency in Microsoft Office—MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
* Exceptional written, oral, and interpersonal skills
* Results-oriented with high attention to detail
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a demanding, fast-paced environment
* Proficiency in virtual meeting/collaboration, project management, and survey software (e.g., Zoom, Teams, Asana, Survey Monkey, Higher Logic)
* Ability to quickly learn new software platforms and programs
* Ability to travel up to 20%
* PMP certification is preferred, but not required

title: Manager, Training Operations
description:
**Manager, Training Operations**
================================

Position Overview:


At Bloom, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the insurance industry through innovation and excellence. We are seeking an experienced and dedicated leader responsible for conducting training and leading all tactical aspects of Bloom’s Training Department. This includes oversight of staff (both permanent and seasonal), training delivery, training administration, and supporting the organization in agent improvement to meet client goals.


### **We are looking for an exceptional individual who can:**


* Manage training specialists to deliver education and training programs according to business needs.
* Coordinate training operations, including scheduling, required resources and coordinating/delivering client-related tasks.
* Implement new training content in support of client and business needs.
* Conduct regular team meetings/forums to communicate process, policy, and procedures, project updates and administrative updates.
* Consistent review of training materials and scripting to ensure alignment.
* Ensure tracking of all training attendance and individual training records.
* Facilitate cross-department communication and processes relating to agent status and training completion.
* Support the Operations Teams with targeted training review to assist with performance and process improvement.
* Assist with training delivery and high standard of delivery across all team members.
* Develop permanent and seasonal team members for continuous improvement.
* Assist with additional projects as needed.
* Remain current with industry changes to ensure up-to-date training.
* Attend business meetings as required to promote Bloom’s Training Department and agent improvement.
* Assist in special projects as needed to support business needs.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.

### **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Training and Development, Education, Health Administration or related field required
* Health Insurance License required
* 5+ years of leadership experience in training or Learning and Development related role
* Medicare/Medicaid/Individual Insurance experience required


### **Required Skills and Abilities**


* Detail-oriented with good analytical skills
* Excellent working knowledge of Medicare Advantage, Under 65 plans, CMS regulations and insurance industry in general
* Self-starter and ability to research and become subject matter expert in new areas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Professional demeanor, ability to be client-facing
* Competent in Microsoft Office products, particularly Word, Excel and Access
* Ability to work well under pressure and to deadlines
* Strong leader of people, ability to develop team members


What We Offer


Bloom operates with a people-first culture, which means listening to our employees to provide the benefits that mean the most to them. Our competitive compensation, comprehensive health coverage, long-term growth opportunities, and remote work environment are among the reasons that many of our employees have been with us since the beginning of our business. BeBloom™, our proprietary employee training and engagement program, helps you learn our business model and immerse yourself in everything our culture has to offer from day 1. From virtual live events to mentorship and leadership programs and employee-led councils, there are countless opportunities to get involved, build connections, and share your voice – because at Bloom, the **real** you belongs here.

title: Training Specialist
description:
**Training Specialist**
=======================


Position Overview:


At Bloom, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the insurance industry through innovation and excellence. We are seeking an experienced and dedicated individual to lead efforts to implement a training program for new representatives in a call center environment. This role will involve mentorship from the training program to a team of seasonal trainers during the Annual Enrollment Period (AEP). Following AEP season, this position will serve as the primary trainer to continue the efforts of the training department. This hands-on role will report to the Training Operations Manager to ensure the success of training initiatives to include in-person and remote training.


### **We are looking for an exceptional individual who can:**


* Lead daily classes. At times, more than one class may be conducted.
* Trains, motivates, evaluates, and coaches new and existing agents on procedures, sales techniques, and performance goals.
* Works as a Change Champion by planning, communicating, and implementing Operational changes.
* Participate in the planning and on-boarding of new & existing agents.
* Available to answer questions, manage escalations and give ongoing consistent feedback.
* Educate new & existing agents on calls with system, policy, program and procedure knowledge.
* Attend formal one-on-one meetings to review and discuss performance, goal attainment and career development.
* Manages and monitors daily workflow and reporting to ensure business objectives are maintained and accurately reported.
* Use reporting tools, product knowledge, and sales strategies to coach, mentor and motivate sales agents as needed.
* Observe calls either live or via Quality reports, accurately provide professional coaching feedback to improve employee performance.
* Effectively communicates compliance requirements to agents and escalates compliance observations/risks to the Education & Training Department & the Compliance Department.
* May be asked to support production in agent capacity during peak seasons.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.


### **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Education, Adult Learning, Health Administration or related field; or 4+ years of related experience
* Health Insurance License is required
* 1+ Affordable Care Act/Marketplace/Medicare/Medicaid/Individual Insurance sales experience required
* 1+ years of experience delivering exceptional instructor-lead in-person and/or virtual training


### **Required Skills and Abilities**


* Must possess excellent oral and interpersonal communication skills
* Able to effectively communicate and lead (control) a group of 20+
* Comfortable facilitating educational activities such as role-plays and interactive exercises
* Able to adapt to changing routines and roles (support/lead/administration), as well as needs of the department
* Excel at computer skills: general usability, keyboarding, internet, equipment, and Microsoft Office 365 applications
* Excellent attention to detail in record keeping
* Possess excellent problem-solving skills
* Available to work all shifts in preparation for Annual Enrollment Period
* Extended hours are required during ramp-up period
* People motivator/ influencer
* Quick to learn and assimilate information, distill, and communicate effectively
* Able to prioritize tasks to complete effectively and efficiently
* Comfortable giving critical performance feedback
* Able to lead as well as work well within a team
* Can effectively manage time and perform under pressure


What We Offer


Bloom operates with a people-first culture, which means listening to our employees to provide the benefits that mean the most to them. Our competitive compensation, comprehensive health coverage, long-term growth opportunities, and remote work environment are among the reasons that many of our employees have been with us since the beginning of our business. BeBloom™, our proprietary employee training and engagement program, helps you learn our business model and immerse yourself in everything our culture has to offer from day 1. From virtual live events to mentorship and leadership programs and employee-led councils, there are countless opportunities to get involved, build connections, and share your voice – because at Bloom, the **real** you belongs here.


Core Values:


* **Put People First:** Uphold and promote a people-first culture within the organization, emphasizing empathy, kindness, and a commitment to making a positive difference.


* **Be Stronger Together:** Embrace a team player mentality, leveraging the strengths of yourself and others to collaborate as one team.


* **Do What’s Right:** Adhere to high ethical standards, acting with integrity to do what’s right for partners, customers, and colleagues.


* **Embrace a Growth Mindset:** Embrace a culture of continuous learning, education, and professional development.


* **Drive Solutions:** Demonstrate ingenuity and skill by sharing ideas and solutions that drive our mission forward.


### **About Bloom**


Bloom is a third-party insurance services provider that partners with Medicare health plans to enable high-quality Medicare enrollment and drive earlier health plan activation. Founded in 2007, Bloom has partnered with national and regional payers to implement solutions for every step of the member journey, from telesales and quote & enroll to health activation outreach. Supported by its Ascend technology platform, Bloom produces closer connections and better outcomes for Medicare beneficiaries and health plan stakeholders to deliver High Value Enrollment.

title: Training and Development Specialist
description:
**Who WE are:**


RailPros is a leading engineering and safety services company in the rail and transit industry. Our mission is to enhance mobility, safety, and quality of life for residents, passengers, and companies. We achieve this by providing unique services to rail and transit companies across North America. Through teamwork, continuous improvement, and a passion for excellence, we strive to understand our customers' challenges and earn their trust. Our dedication to staying updated on industry developments enables us to help our customers succeed. We are driven by a shared goal of keeping America moving and ensuring customer satisfaction.

  



**Keywords:** #Railway, #CivilEngineer, #Transportation, #RailPros, #Infrastructure, #TrackDesign, #ConstructionManagement, #Railroad, #Engineering, #ProjectManagement, #RailwayDesign, #TransportationEngineering, #RailwayConstruction, #CivilEngineering, #RailroadInfrastructure, #TrackMaintenance, #RailTransport, #RailwayOperations, #StructuralEngineering, #GeotechnicalEngineering. #FRARegulations, #RailSafety, #Class1Railroads, #Certification, #RailwayStandards, #TrackInspection, #RailroadMaintenance, #SafetyStandards, #TransportationSafety, #RailwayDesignStandards, #FRACompliance, #RailwayMaintenance, #RailwayInfrastructureDesign, #TrackSafety, #RailroadOperations, #CertifiedEngineer, #RailwaySafety, #FRAStandards, #Class1Railways.

**Job Summary:**


The Instructional Design & Training Producer will help our team continuously improve the quality and impact of our learning content and instructional design across new and existing courses.

  

This position is responsible for design and development of learning experiences for RailPros employees and customers (internal and external products). This person collaborates with subject matter experts and customers to assess developmental needs and identify suitable training solutions, then works with the team to produce and implement the solutions.

  

As part of the RailPros Training and Development team, the Instructional Design & Training Producer will create training for both eLearning and Instructor-led products. Training type is generally safety training and technical skills training. Content is developed using various instructional methodologies and treatments.

  



RailPros training products often make heavy use of multi-media assets and technology, and as such, this position is responsible for managing the production and implementation of media assets used for training. This position actively searches, creatively designs, and implements effective methods to educate, enhance performance, assess and recognize performance.

 **Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Apply adult learning principles and instructional design best practices to create engaging learning activities and compelling course content material/media (audio, video, simulations, games etc.)
* Own the end-to-end design and development of learning content, including modes of assessment to measure the effectiveness and application of training.
* Design learning that reflects an understanding of the diversity of learning styles to ensure that learning solutions resonate with increasingly diverse audience.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts to identify training needs/ knowledge gaps
* Suggest curriculum-based recommendations based on requirements analysis
* State instructional end goals and create content to match.
* Help write Project Proposals, to include Project Scope, Design Plan, timelines and budgets
* Develop training deliverables/ collateral in part or in full for multiple projects, including Training Design Documents, ILT Instructor Guides, Student Workbooks, Exams, presentations, eLearning storyboards, eLearning modules/ programs, and surveys.
* Work with a team to create supporting material/media, including (audio, video, animations, simulations, role plays, games, etc).
* Provide exercises and activities that enhance the learning process.
* Decide on the criteria used to judge learner’s performance and develop assessment instruments.
* Maintain project documentation and course folders.
* Administers spending against the departmental/ project budget.
* Conduct follow-up studies of all completed training to evaluate and measure results.
* Modify/ revise programs as needed.
* Other duties as assigned or required to meet the business needs.

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:**

* Knowledge and understanding of adult learning theory and instructional design methodologies for classroom-based, self-guided, and virtual training
* Experience working with e-learning development tools (Articulate, Captivate, etc.)
* Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint
* Partnering effectively with others to achieve results
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to proofread work of self, and others, to improve quality, consistency, and readability
* Ability to write effective copy, instructional text, audio scripts/video scripts
* Highly proficient in time management, organization, planning and prioritization
* Proficiency with electronic communications including e-mail and text as well as standard office applications (i.e., Microsoft Office Suite)

 **Required Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in Communications, Instructional Design, or relevant field.
* 4+ years’ experience designing and implementing employee development programs (or similar experience).

 **Preferred Education and Experience:**

* HTML5 competency
* Experience in railroad or similar industry
* Experience with media production
* Experience working within a Learning Management System (LMS)

 **Additional Qualifications, Certifications, etc.:**

* Certified Professional in Learning and Performance (CPLP) credential preferred.
* SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-CP) or SHRM Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP) credential preferred.

 **Why RailPros:**

* **Professional Development and Support:** RailPros offers new graduates the opportunity to kick-start their engineering career with a supportive mentor or buddy program, ensuring they receive guidance, training, and resources to enhance their skills and knowledge in the railway industry.
* **Hands-On Experience:** Working at RailPros provides new graduates with the chance to gain valuable hands-on experience in designing and developing railroad infrastructure projects, allowing them to apply their academic knowledge in a practical setting while receiving guidance from experienced professionals.
* **Career Growth Opportunities:** RailPros is committed to providing a pathway for career growth and advancement for new graduates. The mentor or buddy program, along with ongoing training and resources, sets the stage for continuous professional development and opportunities for advancement within the company.
* **Involvement in Meaningful Projects:** New graduates at RailPros have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful and impactful projects in the railroad industry, allowing them to make a tangible difference while learning from experienced mentors and gaining exposure to diverse aspects of engineering.

 **Benefits / Perks:**

* Comprehensive Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Accident Plan, Critical Illness Plan, Hospital Indemnity (Employee to Family Coverage)
* Life and Disability Insurance Coverage (Employer Paid, plus Voluntary Options)
* Retirement Savings Plans (401(k) with Employer Match)
* Paid Time Off (Paid Time Off, Holidays)
* Wellness Programs
* Discount Programs
* Company-funded allowance for merchandise in our on-line store
* Health Savings Accounts (HSA) with Employer Match
* Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) – Employer Funded
* Flexible Spending Accounts - Dependent Care (FSA)
* Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
* Professional Development and Training Opportunities
* Work-Life Balance Initiatives

  

Join RailPros for a fulfilling career in a thriving and stable industry. Our core values drive us to excel as a team, prioritize customer satisfaction, and adapt to industry changes swiftly. Be part of a passionate and dedicated team that values continuous improvement, trust, and problem-solving. Apply now for an opportunity to contribute to our success.

  



**Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO):**

  

RailPros provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. We are committed to making reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless such accommodations would impose undue hardship on our business operations. If you are considering applying for a job and require a reasonable accommodation in accordance with the ADA, please reach out to us at peopleoperations@railpros.com.

title: Learning & Development Consultant 2
description:
What You'll Do:

We take pride in being a purpose-led firm, motivated by our mission to make financial security accessible to all. Our mission, integrity, and customer focus have made us a trusted leader for more than 140 years!

  

Are you passionate about learning and development? As a Learning & Development Consultant 2 you’ll use instructional design methods to create and deliver learning programs for our Retirement and Income Solutions Individual Solutions Sales team. You’ll engage in each phase of the L&D process from initial consultation on training needs, determining delivery method and training deployment.

 **In this role, you’ll be responsible for:**

* Development and deployment of training topics focused within the ongoing and growth development areas for the Individual Solutions Sales team.
* Address learning opportunities and identify gaps and process improvements in the training curriculum.
* Collaborate with leaders, business partners, other trainers, and project teams to develop the necessary learning programs to support training initiatives.

Success in this position requires strong communication, critical thinking to identify and implement solutions and interpersonal skills to build relationships to accomplish the team's training goals. This role doesn’t have a traditional roadmap, you must be a self-starter that’s open to thinking of new ways to deliver training to our audiences.


Who You Are:  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent and 4+ years of related training or instructional design experience required.
* Successful Registration as an Investment Company Products/Variable contracts Limited Representative (FINRA Series 6 or equivalent and FINRA Series 63) within 90 days of employment required.
* Instructional design methodology and practice required, with the emphasis on adult learning.
* Results driven and detail oriented with the ability to manage change in a dynamic environment.
* Demonstrate effective organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills (verbal and written)
* Basic PC skills in Microsoft Office are also necessary.
* Some travel may be required (10% or less)

**A successful candidate will have:**

* Strong analytical, leadership, problem-solving, decision-making, negotiation, planning, facilitation, and presentation skills
* Business knowledge of how our Retirement and Income Solutions Teams operate as well as experience supporting our Individual Solutions Sales team preferred.


Salary Range Information: Salary ranges below reflect targeted base salaries. Non-sales positions have the opportunity to participate in a bonus program. Sales positions are eligible for sales incentives, and in some instances a bonus plan, whereby total compensation may far exceed base salary depending on individual performance. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Salary Range: $51000 - $121200 / year Time Off Program: Flexible Time Off (FTO) is provided to salaried (exempt) employees and provides the opportunity to take time away from the office with pay for vacation, personal or short-term illness. Employees don’t accrue a bank of time off under FTO and there is no set number of days provided. Additional Information:
**Work Environments**


This role offers in-office, hybrid (blending at least three office days in a typical workweek), and remote work arrangements (only if residing more than 30 miles from Des Moines, IA, or Charlotte, NC). You’ll work with your leader to figure out which option may align best based on several factors.

 **Job level**


We’ll consider talent at the next level with the right experiences and skills.

**Work Authorization/Sponsorship**


At this time, we're not considering candidates that need any type of immigration sponsorship (additional work authorization or permanent work authorization) now or in the future to work in the United States? This includes, but IS NOT LIMITED TO: F1-OPT, F1-CPT, H-1B, TN, L-1, J-1, etc. For additional information around work authorization needs please use the following links.

**Nonimmigrant Workers** **and** **Green Card for Employment-Based Immigrants**

**Investment Code of Ethics**


For Principal Asset Management positions, you’ll need to follow an Investment Code of Ethics related to personal and business conduct as well as personal trading activities for you and members of your household. These same requirements may also apply to other positions across the organization.

**Experience Principal**


While our expertise spans the globe, we're bound by one common purpose: to foster a world where financial security is accessible to all. And our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees – individually and all of us together. Explore our core values, benefits and why we’re an exceptional place to grow your career.

 **Principal is an Equal Opportunity Employer**


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.


Posting Window: We will accept applications for 3 full days following the Original Posting Date, after which the posting may remain open or be removed based upon applications received. If we choose to post the job again, we will accept additional applications for at least 1 full day following the Most Recently Posted Date. Please submit applications in a timely manner as there is no guarantee the posting will be available beyond the applicable deadline. title: Associate Consultant PS Supply Chain Services
description:
When you’re the best, we’re the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents while living and working as their authentic selves. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance through an inclusive environment both now and in the future.

**Summary:**


In this role, you will support the strategy development and execution of the project plans in conjunction with logistics services and solutions initiatives within hospital supply chain departments. You will gather and compile internal and external data from qualitative and quantitative sources (e.g., systems, observations, and interviews), conduct detailed analyses to generate strategic insight and interpret information to identify saving opportunities. You will and provide implementation support of new supply chain processes from conception, planning, design, and implementation.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide implementation support of savings focusing on performance targets and/or operational improvements.
* Support the consulting supply chain experts in the areas of service line management, including supply chain operations, inventory management, PAR replenishment, operating room inventory flow, and process maps.
* Design and assemble stocking locations for hospital clean supply storage rooms based on product type and input from the hospital stakeholders to include clinicians and supply chain management.
* Collect data from various member source systems (e.g., patient financial, material management, decision support) to use in analysis.
* Conduct analyses on supply spend, operational and/or performance improvement related data. Support work to develop request for proposals (“RFPs”) and analysis of vendor responses.
* Create presentations using data and other relevant inputs (e.g., interviews) to drive an action for customer performance improvement.
* Provide support to consultants and senior consultants on member engagements including research, development of presentations meeting preparation, status report preparation, issue identification and tracking/updating project budgets.
* Support collaboration and integration across all Advisory Solutions services.

**Qualification****s:**

* Relevant degree preferred.
* No prior experience required.
* Supply Chain Management intern experience ideal.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills needed.
* Ability to simultaneously manage and prioritize multiple projects.
* This position is a remote role that requires travel Monday through Friday to hospital site locations throughout the U.S.
* Ability to travel regularly and expeditiously throughout the year to meet clients’ needs and timetables.

**Estimated Hiring Range:**


$41,500.00 - $66,400.00
This position is also incentive eligible.


Vizient has a comprehensive benefits plan! Please view our benefits here:


http://www.vizientinc.com/about-us/careers

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** **Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals** **with Disabilities**


The Company is committed to equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender identity, ethnicity, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability status, veteran status or any other category protected by applicable law.

title: Resource Mobilization Consultant
description:
###### **LOCATION :**


Home-based


###### **TYPE OF CONTRACT :**


Individual Contract


###### **STARTING DATE :**


01-Apr-2024


###### **APPLICATION DEADLINE :**


11-Mar-24 (Midnight New York, USA)


###### **POST LEVEL :**


International Consultant


###### **DURATION OF INITIAL CONTRACT :**


6 Months


###### **TIME LEFT :**


5d 13h 53m


###### **LANGUAGES REQUIRED :**


English


###### **EXPECTED DURATION OF ASSIGNMENT :**


6 Months


  
**Background**
--------------


UN Women, grounded in the vision of equality enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations, works for the elimination of discrimination against women and girls; the empowerment of women; and the achievement of equality between women and men as partners and beneficiaries of development, human rights, humanitarian action and peace and security.


Generation Equality was initiated to disrupt decades of under-investment and lack of progress on gender equality implementation. The initiative intends to support the achievement of the SDGs and the realization of the 1995 Beijing Platform for Action on women’s rights. With the intersecting challenges to gender inequality of COVID-19, the climate crisis, growing conflicts and intensified economic and political instability, the initiative aims both to stop reversals in women’s and girls’ rights as well as accelerate concrete progress.  

  

Generation Equality was launched in 2021 at events in Mexico and France, and in the presence of Heads of State, VIPs, CEOs and civil society and youth leaders and activists. Initially conceived as a five-year initiative, work will continue through and beyond 2026 to enroll new commitment makers, press for collective action on gender equality and ensure accountability.


A Coordination Hub has been established in the Office of the Executive Director to foster, promote and enable a whole-of-organization approach to UN Women’s role as convenor of Generation Equality in line with the Phase II Project Document. The Hub coordinates the timely and quality delivery of project results through effective and efficient management and oversight of the project: systematic planning; monitoring, reporting and evaluation; resource management; operations support; knowledge management; internal and external coordination, communications and stakeholder engagement; cross Action Coalitions/Compact collaboration; localization; partnerships and resource mobilization. It liaises with UN Women’s leadership, senior management and Regional and Country Offices, and promotes a coordinated approach to political outreach and advocacy opportunities.


Under the direct supervision of the Special Advisor at the Generation Equality Coordination Hub, the Consultant will research and development resource mobilization plans, activities and follow up.


**Duties and Responsibilities**
-------------------------------


* Develop a resource mobilization action plan to meet funding targets for UN Women’s convenor role of Generation Equality with a focus on the public sector/government donors.
* Undertake analysis and research to develop partner intelligence aligned with the needs and opportunities of Generation Equality.
* Develop targeted pitches and proposals to secure funding for immediate to mid-term needs of UN Women’s convenor role.
* Prepare complementary materials – including key messages, briefing notes, presentations – to support donor pitches and outreach.
* Provide recommendations for targeted outreach opportunities in line with funding targets.
* Maintain online knowledge repository for donor and resource mobilization intelligence and tools.
* Coordinate with relevant teams across UN Women to ensure timely, quality inputs to resource mobilization tools.
* Perform other related functions as required.

**Consultant’s Workplace and Official Travel**


This is a home-based consultancy.


**Competencies**
----------------


Core Values:

* Respect for Diversity
* Integrity
* Professionalism


Core Competencies:

* Awareness and Sensitivity Regarding Gender Issues
* Accountability
* Creative Problem Solving
* Effective Communication
* Inclusive Collaboration
* Stakeholder Engagement
* Leading by Example


Please visit this link for more information on UN Women’s Core Values and Competencies:


https://www.unwomen.org/en/about-us/employment/application-process#\\_Values


FUNCTIONAL COMPETENCIES:

* Demonstrates very good understanding and experience in resource mobilization.
* Good knowledge of gender equality issues.
* Excellent written and oral English communication skills.
* Very strong planning, coordination and organizational skills.
* Demonstrates very good experience in use of online tools for developing effective RM outreach materials.
* Strong analytical skills.
* Demonstrated ability to work well as part of a team and to take own initiative.
* Ability to work well under pressure and to meet deadlines.


**Required Skills and Experience**
----------------------------------


**Education and certification:**

* Master’s degree or equivalent in economics, business management, social sciences, public administration, international relations, communications, women's studies, or a related field is required.
* A first-level university degree in combination with two additional years of qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree.

**Experience:**

* At least 5 years of progressively responsible work experience in resource mobilization with a focus on the public sector.
* Experience in the UN System required. Experience in UN Women is an asset.
* Proven track record of contributing to the successful mobilization of financial resources from the public sector for development and/or human rights priorities is required.
* Experience in resource mobilization with philanthropies and/or the private sector is an asset.

**Languages:**

* Fluency in English is required.
* Knowledge of another UN official language is an asset.

**How to Apply:**

* **Personal CV or P11 (P11 can** **be downloaded from:** https://www.unwomen.org/sites/default/files/Headquarters/Attachments/Sections/About%20Us/Employment/UN-Women-P11-Personal-History-Form.doc )

title: Revenue Operations Consultant
description:
SaaScend is a rapidly growing revenue operations consultancy that works closely with Go-To-Market teams at B2B Companies.

We provide expert guidance for optimizing processes and systems, which enables unified focus on growth, better decision-making, and allows these businesses to achieve their ultimate revenue potential.

At SaaScend, we believe in giving our team members the ability to pave their own paths and the means to make a significant impact very quickly. We are a highly collaborative team across all departments internally and place a high importance on maintaining a strong remote first team culture.

We encourage support and investment in the growth and well-being of each member. We actively invest in our team, which we call the “teamo” and collaborate with each other to propel not only our hard skills in systems but also soft skills to become better consultants.

We scale not only our clients with intention but also our people to become the best version of themselves. Our RevOps consultants are critical to the success of our clients as the primary builders and configuration backbone of SaaScend.

We incorporate a pod structure which enables our RevOps consultants to work with multiple Lead RevOps Consultants to learn how to run accounts of different sizes and gain multiple mentors for 1:1 coaching on skills.

We are looking for a RevOps Consultant who will help support our team on the execution of technical implementations and development projects, and provide technical support for their sales and marketing systems and databases. The ideal candidate for this role would be able to work with internal and external teams to ensure that we meet all project requirements, manage multiple tasks that come from various clients, and have a deep and clear understanding of each client’s internal processes and business objectives.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Be a supporting technical consultant for a portfolio of B2B companies, with a key focus on truly understanding the client’s business challenges and goals and delivering the highest level of customer satisfaction
* Partner with clients and their teams to set up their software and systems for success
* Follow a sprint structure outlined by our lead consultants to hit deadlines to build our clients GTM systems up toward a better future
* Act as the first point of contact for ticketing and support issues from your dedicated book of clients when bugs or features request arise
* Work with our lead consultants to build data architecture, integrations, reporting, and automation in a variety of GTM systems including but not limited to Salesforce, Hubspot, Outreach, Gong, Tray.io, Zoominfo, Apollo, Clearbit, LeanData, Gainsight, Marketo, Pardot, and more
* Develop documentation and educational materials to help clients better understand their internal systems and processes
* Collaborate and share knowledge with the rest of the SaaScend team, so we can all learn and grow stronger together

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* 1 to 3+ years of experience as a RevOps Manager, Sales Ops Manager, or Marketing Ops Manager OR 3 to 5+ years of experience as a Salesforce Administrator or Hubspot Administrator
* Deep understanding of primary GTM systems Salesforce, Hubspot, Outreach, Zoominfo, Apollo, Gong, and other sales/marketing systems is a major plus
* Ability to be coached and learn quickly if lacking skills in multiple GTM systems is a requirement. We don’t expect you to know everything, we’ll teach you but you have to be eager to learn.
* Experience building automations such as a Salesforce Flows or Hubspot Workflows is a major plus
* Experience with iPaaS tools such as Zapier, Tray, or Workato is a major plus but not required
* Administrative experience including field, automation, sandbox deployment, report/dashboard building, and workflow management is a major plus
* Proven track record of troubleshooting end user bugs/issues is a plus but not required
* Salesforce and/or Hubspot certifications is a plus but not required
* Experience working with B2B sales or marketing users with an understanding of sales/marketing funnel, metrics, and lingo is a major plus
* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills, with proficiency in finding clever solutions to complex problems and resolving any data and automation issues
* Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), including communication over video calls, Slack, email, and project management tools
* Proficient organizational skills, especially in regards to task management and meeting deadlines
* Effective team player that’s proactive in asking questions, communicating any issues, and supporting other members of the team
* Enthusiasm and motivation to continue learning and growing your skillset and taking the initiative to go the extra mile whenever possible
* Ability to be flexible and adaptable when it comes to scheduling of meetings and priority shifting of tasks
* Passion for sales/marketing/revenue operations and technologies a plus

**BENEFITS:**

* Competitive salary
* Medical benefits
* Annual team retreat to amazing locations around the world
* Fun internal programs and bi-annual bonus based on performance

**HOW WE WORK:**

* 100% remote (work where you love, as long as there’s good internet)
* Communication over Slack and team Zoom calls
* Project and task management using Asana
* Time tracking using Everhour
* Development of personal and professional growth plans
* Pod structure working with multiple teams and client types
* Weekly 1-on-1s with your manager

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid parental leave
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Stock options
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Salesforce: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft Excel: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Salesforce Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Management Consultant- Procurement Policy and Analysis (Remote)
description:
### **Job Description**


Jefferson Consulting Group, a well-respected, minority- and woman-owned small business, seeks a highly qualified individual to serve as a **M****anagement Consultant- Procurement Policy and Analysis**. Jefferson provides strategic and operational services to federal agencies in program management, acquisition, human capital and training. The Management Consultant will be supporting multiple projects across those domains. This will be a full-time, REMOTE position within the Infrastructure and Natural Resources Portfolio.

 **Management Consultant- Procurement Policy and Analysis** is a role that works as part of a team to support the process and develop documents to assist in developing, tracking, updating, and implementing new and revised policy, directives, operating procedures, manuals, instructions, and guidance by:

* Supporting the shepherding of new or revised guidance through the policy review process
* Conducting internal stakeholder briefings and information gathering sessions to share information about draft guidance and absorb feedback
* Conducting comprehensive research and process analysis in collaboration with Government stakeholders
* Supporting data analytics, trends analysis, and reporting needs
* Implementing policy, tools, training, and programs to ensure regulation compliance
* Conducting contract compliance reviews
* Responding with recommendations to inquiries from GAO and OIG.
* Developing and delivering training
* Coordinate meetings, conference calls, and track project activities.
* Create, maintain, and adhere to project plans and schedules.
* Develop high quality templates, frameworks, and reports.
* Facilitate and support meetings, including working with stakeholders to develop agendas, co-leading facilitation of the meeting, and documenting and following up on action items.


This type of role requires:

* Years of **federal acquisition experience: Mid 4-7 years, Senior 7+ years****.**
* Education: Bachelor’s Degree
* CSAW, FAC-C, or DAWIA Level certification or equivalent desired
* Federal acquisition policy development and compliance experience
* Data analytics and visualization experience using Microsoft 365 tool suite- Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, etc.,


We are seeking individuals who have:

* Strong organizational, interpersonal, communication, writing and analytical skills to effectively interact with program and contracting officials.
* Attention to detail, high standards of excellence and commitment to perform and execute all project activities successfully.
### **About Jefferson Consulting**


Jefferson Consulting Group is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin, genetic data, veteran status, or any category protected by law.


Jefferson Consulting Group is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, JCG will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations for the hiring process. If reasonable accommodation is needed, please contact the Human Resources Department at (202) 626-8550 via email: HR@jeffersonconsulting.com

title: CONSULTANT VI - QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH
description:
**1. BACKGROUND TO THE ASSIGNMENT:**

International Medical Corps is a global first responder, delivering emergency medical and related services to those affected by conflict, disaster, and disease. Our mission is to improve quality of

life through health services and related interventions that strengthen underserved communities worldwide. With the flexibility to respond rapidly to emergencies, we also offer medical services and training to people at the highest risk, always working to strengthen local healthcare systems and promote self-reliance.

The **Quality Assurance, Research, and Innovations department (QARI),** provides leadership and technical oversight of International Medical Corps’ (IMC) global programs. The department’s Technical Unit (TU) hosts multiple disciplines that support program sector areas including, public health, health systems, Mental health and psychosocial support, child protection, gender-based violence, water, sanitation and hygiene, nutrition, and food security and livelihoods. The

Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Unit complements the core sector expertise through providing advisory services for routine and formative program monitoring and evaluation.

**The Research, Evidence and Learning (REL) Unit** is a new addition under the QARI Department, building on IMC’s successful track record for applied research over the past ten years and further investing in shaping and creating the future of our evidence generation and learning.

The unit supports the design and implementation of a wide range of scientific and operational research alongside IMC country teams and established partners.

As International Medical Corps’ research and evidence portfolio expands, additional expertise is required on new research opportunities. The REL Unit is seeking an experienced researcher to provide technical support in study design, statistical analysis, and reporting.

**2. PURPOSE OF THE ASSIGNMENT:**

The Consultant will bring expertise and knowledge primarily in quantitative study design and statistical analysis. The consultant will be responsible for supporting: 1) the development of new research studies, 2) data analysis and 3) preparation of manuscripts.

The Consultant will work closely with all relevant REL focal points, as well as QARI department focal points for research. The consultant will be managed by the Senior Advisor, Global MEAL & Research with oversight by the Senior Director (QARI department).

**3. SCOPE OF THE ASSIGNMENT:**

* Support the conceptualization, design, and development of new research studies.
* Perform quantitative data analysis according to analysis plans.
* Contribute to the write-up of manuscripts.

**4. DELIVERABLES DESCRIPTION**

**1. New Research Study Development**

* Support the conceptualization, design, and development of new research studies, including proposing suitable and contextually appropriate methods based on research questions and context.
* Support in drafting study proposals, protocols, and data analysis plans as needed.
* Perform sample size and power calculations for a variety of study design methods and scenarios.
* Support the ethical approval process for new studies at national and international levels as needed.

**2. Data Collection and Analysis**

* Support or lead the development of data collection tools based on the proposal.
* Develop protocols and code to automate data quality management systems.
* Summarize data using relevant univariable and bivariable analysis techniques.
* Perform advanced analyses including development of multivariable models.
* Prepare clear analysis files with step-by-step explanations and interpretation of output including creating graphics and tables displaying results.

**3. Preparation of Manuscripts**

* Assist in the preparation of manuscripts for peer-reviewed journals, including writing methods and results sections as well as creating publication-quality tables and figures, and assisting with the revision of manuscripts.

Perform other duties as assigned. The duties and responsibilities listed above are representative of the nature and level of work assigned and are not necessarily all inclusive.

Deadlines to be determined when Consultant is identified. Additional hours of work are planned for internal onboarding procedures and routine communication.

**4.1. IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ASSIGNMENT DELIVERABLES**

The Consultant will work independently, for an estimated 5 days/ month effective from November 15, 2023 – June 30, 2024 to achieve the deliverables outlined above.

**5. SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS**

**Qualifications and Experience**

* Masters (minimum 6 years of proven research project design, implementation and production of evidence) OR PhD (minimum 4 years in research project design, implementation and production of evidence) in Public Health or related field;
* Experience in quantitative study design and statistical analysis; research proposal development; study protocols and analysis plans; and manuscript writing.

Desirable: Advanced coursework in biostatistics, epidemiology, or a related quantitative field Experience with randomized trials; applied experience or capability to apply quasi-experimental methods in study design and analysis.

**Competencies**

* Strong research and analytical skills;
* Prior experience developing predictive and causal models;
* Expertise with Stata, SAS, or R (preferred) software for data analysis. (Note: consultant should have an existing license to use subscription- based statistical software as IMC will not provide this);
* Ability to present data visually through informative figures and charts;
* Demonstrated competency in writing quantitative research articles (please add references to CV);
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Desirable: Applied experience with multiple types of regression models, particularly logistic, poisson and cox regression and mixed effects models; Prior experience analyzing complex survey data from cross-sectional studies; Ability to perform survival analysis.

**Language(s)** Fluency in English, both written and oral, is required.

To perform this consultancy successfully, an individual must be able to perform each task with or without reasonable accommodation.​​​​​​​

Please refer to the Scope of Work above to view this Individual Consultancy details and requirements.

**Code of Conduct**  
As applicable to this position, an individual must promote and encourage a culture of compliance and ethics throughout the organization and maintain a clear understanding of International Medical Corps and donor compliance and ethics standards and adheres to those standards.

**Safeguarding**  
It is all staff shared responsibility and obligation to safeguard and protect populations with whom we work, including adults who may be particularly vulnerable and children. This includes safeguarding from the following conduct by our staff or partners: sexual exploitation and abuse; exploitation, neglect, or abuse of children, adults at risk, or LGBTI individuals; and any form of trafficking in persons. Staff are also responsible for preventing violations to our Code of Conduct and Ethics, which may involve Conflicts of Interest, Fraud, Corruption or Harassment. If you see, hear or are made aware of any violations to the Code of Conduct and Ethics or Safeguarding Policy, you have an obligation to report.

**Equal Opportunities**  
International Medical Corps is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, age, disability or status as a veteran.

Salary: $300.00 - $499.00 per day

* MATLAB: 1 year (Preferred)
* Android: 1 year (Preferred)

Security clearance:

title: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Consultant
description:
**Company Profile:**

Vision Planning and Consulting, LLC (VPC) specializes in business continuity, technology solutions, hazard mitigation, community planning, grants management, web development, and public outreach. We pride ourselves in creating synergies between all levels of government, academia, and the public, and developing strategies that result in safe, sustainable, communities, and preparing them to meet short- and long-term challenges.

**Position Description:**

VPC is seeking **candidates for an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Consultant.** Thisposition will provide support to one of our clients in the southeast United States. The ideal candidate would possess 5-10 years of ERP experience; however, mature candidates are encouraged to apply. The position will provide **remote** support as a 1099 Contractor, and may include some **potential travel** to the project site in South Florida.

**Duration:**

Ten (10) to twelve (12) months.

**Pay:**

The hourly rate for this position is $65-$80/hour.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conducts an assessment with County departments and stakeholders.
* Assesses and procures an ERP like Workday, Oracle, SAP.
* Creates an RFP document with specifications for an ERP.
* Assists with proposal responses.
* Assists with facilitating vendor demonstrations
* Determines requirements for proposals.
* Writes specifications for proposals and the RFP.
* Reviews and helps score proposals.
* Reviews business practices.
* Provides implementation assistance.

**Qualifications/Skill Requirements:**

* Possesses business and technical skill sets.
* Working knowledge and experience in organizational change management, systems integration, and data migration.
* Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and communicate the project. objectives, inspire and motivate staff, and maintain alignment with the business strategy.
* Possesses a high degree of political sensitivity, astuteness, and the ability to effectively use the informal power structure of the organization to achieve success and clear obstacles for the project.
* Ability to multi-task and work effectively under pressure and with deadlines.
* Highly empathetic and able to vary styles of interaction to match the needs of a variety of temperaments and personalities.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain and "sell" the project goals and objectives to the organization, as well as technical leadership.
* Effective influencing and negotiation experience and skills in an environment with high competition for resources.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver against financial and resource constraints.
* Knowledge of project planning tools, such as Microsoft Project and Jira, with evidence of practical application.
* Deep understanding of current and emerging technologies, how other enterprises are employing them to drive digital business.
* Demonstrated and proven ability to work with multi-discipline teams, analyze problems, propose solutions, drive issues to resolution, and make decisions, both individually and in a group.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills; ability to prioritize and complete tasks in a timely manner, with a strong attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Government experience is preferred.

VPC is looking to fill this position **as soon as possible.**

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $65.00 - $80.00 per hour

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract

Experience level:

* 10 years
* 5 years
