title: Territory Representative
description:
Job Description:
At Pentair, we are driven to create a better world through smart, sustainable water solutions. Our approximately 11,250 global employees are living our purpose to make the most of water, life’s most essential resource. We work around the globe to deliver industry-leading products, services, and solutions for our customers’ diverse needs in water and other fluids. Our inventive thinking, collaborative spirit, disciplined work ethic and breadth of experts allows us to deliver Inspired Solutions for a Changing World.
INDUSTRIAL SOLUTIONS GROUP Overview
In Industrial Solutions, we are defined by our strong product solutions and deep application expertise, and we strive to be the go-to destination for our customers and partners when solving their toughest industrial filtration challenges. This makes us a great fit with our IFT Segments Vision to “Make the World a better place by being the leader in Smart and Sustainable Solutions in Targeted Critical B2B applications”. In fact, all five product categories in Industrial Solutions contribute to a more sustainable world and truly make a difference.
Role Summary:
We are looking for an enthusiastic Assistant sales manager to manage our Industrial Water category product sales. Suitable candidate is required to create business opportunities and responsibility to sell products (mainly Membrane Bioreactors, Ultra-filtration, and Membrane housings) in the Industrial/commercial market with Consultative Approach to OEMs, EPC, End User & Channel Partners for business development and work closely with Building Services, end users in Food & Beverage, Pharma, Textile, CETPS and Consultants in the region. Incumbent will have to provide sales management for the specified region/territory and sales development activities, in alignment with the strategic direction from the company.
Essential Responsibilities /Expectations:* The Sales resource works closely with internal and external stakeholders to meet assigned objectives.
* Focus on upcoming Green Field projects, ongoing brownfields, and retrofits/replacement business in the region.
* Provide Technical training, inputs to consultants and OEM’s.
* Drive growth by continuously creating and selling customer value propositions, geographical coverage, meeting End User/OEM for assigned territory. Focus on our competitive advantage while leveraging our broad product portfolio.
* Serve as a knowledgeable resource to customers using Pentair technology to solve identified water & wastewater treatment Product needs.
* Partner cross-functionally within organization to optimize our solutions offering.
* Develop a plan to effectively meet sales targets by meeting or exceeding key metrics for revenue, account retention.
* Maintain knowledge of market trends, competitive actions, product needs, and customer base.
* Provide technical support to Channel Partners, OEMs & End Customers on Industrial ZLD applications.
* Using CRM Salesforce for sales management


Experience Required: 5+ years.
Educational Qualification/experience/skills:* Bachelors in Engg degree with 5+ years of Experience in application expertise and technical selling
* Deep domain knowledge in Ultrafiltration & Membrane Bio Reactor
* Well-developed sales skills to make decisions and evaluations to determine the needs of the customers.
* Ability to work on your own initiative and make effective decisions under pressure.
* Willingness to travel frequently.
* Excellent oral, written & strong communication skills in both technical and business terms.
* Excellent customer relations skills
* Treats all employees and customers with dignity, respect, and courtesy.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) and prior use of a CRM tool to manage customer engagements and run sales reports.
* Knowledge of target market industries is highly desirable.
* Strong organizational, analytical and project management skills


Diversity and Inclusion:
With our expanding global presence, cross-cultural insight and competence are essential for our ongoing success. We believe that a diverse workforce contributes different perspectives and creative ideas that enable us to continue to improve every day. Race, gender, ethnicity, country of origin, age, personal style, sexual orientation, physical ability, religion, life experiences and many more factors contribute to this diversity.
We take ongoing action to improve the diversity of our workforce by:* Ensuring leadership involvement and ownership
* Attracting and retaining diverse talent at all levels
* Fostering a globally aware, inclusive culture
* Ensuring our practices are fair and non-discriminatory

title: Compliance Officer
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **Financial Crime Operations Delivery Lead – Senior Manager**  

The Compliance Team at EY GDS partners with other EY offices across the globe to provide an array of compliance solutions to our clients. The team works on short to long term engagements to assist in establishing, maintaining and reviewing the outputs of business functions and compliance programs.  

Financial crime risks relating to anti-money laundering (AML)/ transaction monitoring (TM), know your customer (KYC), terrorist financing, anti-bribery controls, sanctions compliance and fraud are a high focus for regulated businesses and external scrutiny as regulation and practice continues to evolve. As a result, EY GDS is expanding the current team to support financial crime compliance with respect to client acceptance procedures.

 **The opportunity**  

As a Financial Crime Operations Delivery Lead in our Managed Services (MS) Delivery team, you will be working with global EY teams to deliver high quality work to our clients, which will primarily be from the financial services sector. You will be leading teams working on KYC/TM/Screening engagements and will actively participate in the day-to-day management of engagement teams, delegating to the Managers/Senior consultants/Consultants in your team, whilst acting as the interface between local leadership, global project leadership and the client.

 **Your key responsibilities**  

As an Operations Delivery Lead in the Financial Crime Compliance team, you will be required to lead and grow a team and to provide strategic solutions related to regulatory compliance and Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) to our clients in the financial services industry. You will also assist our clients maintain effective and efficient controls, to manage organizational, strategic and regulatory risks.

* You will be responsible for service delivery of an engagement assigned including the following: capacity planning, resource selection and recruitment, IT/Infra & systems access for team, process migration, training, productivity, quality, and escalation of issues, solution design/implementation and stakeholder management.
* You will have to build an understanding of our solutions, share knowledge and be able to draw on subject matter expertise, leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading-edge best practices
* You will be responsible for client liaison and responsible for onshore and client stakeholder engagement
* You will be overseeing the mobilization and project management of engagements
* You will be responsible for ensuring that new or revised standards and regulatory changes are adopted in a timely manner and that a robust change management protocol is in place
* You will be responsible to develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel, whilst building strong internal relationships within Advisory and across other services
* You will be supervising Associates and Executives and Managers in the FinCrime department, solution and engagement level
* You will be overseeing the leadership of onsite engagement teams in FinCrime, including direct supervision of work, ensuring targets are met and all processes and procedures are adhered to
* You will escalate issues and problems in a timely manner and be able to recommend and implement solutions to address the issues.
* You will participate in business development activities at a region, sector and account level and be involved in client pursuits and responding to RFP’s.

 **Skills and attributes for success:**

* You must have 12+ years of Financial Crime experience primarily working with global banks, financial institutions, consulting firms or business process service providers.
* You must have a strong academic background with an MBA/Master’s degree or equivalent qualifications preferably in the Finance/Business domain.
* You must have sound knowledge of AML global regulations and standards such as the EU Money Laundering Directives and FATF Recommendations.
* You must have experience of managing project teams, preferably across a portfolio of engagements.
* You must have leadership, project management and teamwork skills.
* You must have experience in building relationships and networking and exceptional stakeholder management skills.
* You must have strong analytical, interpersonal, communication and writing skills and demonstrated integrity within a professional environment
* Relevant professional qualifications, such as ACAMS, ICA Diploma in Anti Money Laundering, CFE or equivalent would be preferred.
* You should be willing to travel, if required

 **What we look for**  

We are interested in hiring a professional who wants to accelerate knowledge and experience and become an expert in FinCrime. If you are a detail-orientated and highly motivated person, who meets the listed requirements, go ahead and apply for this job.

 **What working at EY GDS offers**  

EY GDS is one of the most admired international professional service firms and it invites bright candidates with a promise to provide them opportunities to grow and succeed. We offer:

* Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around
* Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
* The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Senior Regional Coordinator
description:
INTRODUCTION TO GGGI
====================



The Global Green Growth Institute (GGGI) is a treaty-based international, inter-governmental organization dedicated to supporting and promoting strong, inclusive and sustainable economic growth in developing countries and emerging economies. To learn more please visit about GGGI web page.


###### POSITION SUMMARY



The Senior Officer, Regional Project Coordination, will primarily be responsible for overall coordination and management of the ALCBT program as per the scope of work of the project in 5 countries i.e., Cambodia, India, Indonesia, Thailand and Vietnam.



Being the lead of the Regional Project Management Unit (R-PMU), s/he, under the guidance of the Project Manager (ALCBT), will be responsible for overseeing the project deliverables, co-ordinate with government and project stakeholders, consortium partners, consultants, and peer team members, manage risks, ensure tangible project outcomes & visibility of GGGI, and report to the Project Manager on any eventualities. S/he, under the guidance of Project Manager, will coordinate with Regional PMU and team members of all 5 countries on resource hiring and procurement for successful completion of the project. S/he will review the performance of junior team members of the Regional PMU and consultants as well as being a key point of technical advice and escalation for problem solving within the context of output delivery.



The above will require a broad and in-depth understanding of the building sector i.e., building energy efficiency (EE), policy landscape, ESCO mechanism etc. It also requires skills of project management, effective coordination with clients/consultants, crisis management, collaboration with R-PMU and project staff at GGGI-HQ, PMU in Country Offices, as well as maintaining strategic partnerships with the donor. This position is required to bring the necessary subject expertise, networking skills, sense of client’s priorities etc. This position reports to Project Lead (IKI-ALCBT) & Asia Regional Lead (Energy Efficiency).

  


###### 
PURPOSE


* Develop project execution plan and ensure its timely implementation.
* Facilitate decision making and provision of timely advice through coordination with the donor, government partners, consortium partners, technical advisors, steering committee.
* Provide support to the Central Project Steering Committee.
* Ensure timely submission of project outputs and achievements of milestones through coordination and follow-up with consortium partners, staff, subcontractors, consultants.
* Consolidate inputs and ensure compliance with reporting requirements in coordination with donor, government partners, consortium partners.
* Keep track of budget utilization earmarked for each county to ensure at least 90% utilization of allocated fund every year.
* Facilitate smooth project implementation by coordinating project activities with key partners and stakeholders.
* Coordinate with all project partners, consultants and other stakeholders for all matters relating to IKI project in project countries.
* Manage project-planning, stakeholder consultation, implementation, monitoring and reporting internally and externally.
* Communicate results and recommendations effectively to internal and external stakeholders.
* Review the activities of Knowledge Management and Communication/ Outreach activities under the project.
* Support the development of green policy pipeline from GGGI projects/programs and lead the assistance required to develop a new tracking system for results delivery in-line with GGGI Strategy 2030.

  


###### 
ENGAGEMENT


* Collaborate with other country PMUs and R-PMU of Asia Regional Office on agreed joint activities to ensure integrated delivery as “One GGGI.”
* Maintain active professional relationships with partner governments, external experts and other key stakeholders to keep abreast of evolving needs and opportunities.
* Promote the project objectives and Building Energy Efficiency initiatives of GGGI and comparative advantages with government counterparts, development partners and other stakeholders.
* Contribute to internal communities of practice related to energy efficiency & Climate change.

  


###### 
DELIVERY


* Deliver project activities and results within established timelines and budgets, identify, and communicate project delivery issues and potential solutions to ensure goals and objectives are achieved.
* Organize program activities including consultations, validation meetings, workshops etc. based on work plan and budget.
* Develop ways of working internally and externally to effectively manage project implementation with stakeholders and partners.
* Manage consultants and partnerships in line with GGGI policies as required to deliver the project.
* Develop results reporting, facilitate internal/external communications, maintain project knowledge base with data input from PMUs to perform required analyses for such reporting.
* Execute effective project management in line with GGGI’s project management cycle.
* Use online systems to manage and deliver projects.
* Capture lessons learned to support continuous learning and improvement.

  


###### 
REQUIREMENT

###### QUALIFICATIONS


* Bachelor’s degree in engineering / economics / environment /climate change / science or a related field from a recognized University (Post-Graduate in energy economics / energy management / advanced engineering /climate change / business administration / development or a related field would be an advantage)
* Preferred minimum 10 years of post-qualification professional experience in the field of green growth and development cooperation, out of which 5 years preferably in energy efficiency.
* Experience in managing large scale projects, preferably in the energy sector.
* Experience in dealing with donor agencies and stakeholders (including philanthropic organizations), multilateral, bi-lateral and developmental organizations.
* Experience in handling technical trainings, capacity building and hand-holding programs
* Experience in managing ESCO projects in Energy Efficiency.
* Working experience in any of the 5 project countries, preferably in India

  


###### 
FUNCTIONAL


* Substantial work experience in Central Govt./State Govt./Public Entities
* International/National Certifications related to Project Management; Energy Efficiency & Carbon Trading would be an advantage.
* Demonstrated experience in writing quality proposals, articles, reports, blogs etc.
* Strong competence in the use of standard software programs: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook & SharePoint
* Good communication skills, both verbal and written in English language; working knowledge in any other foreign languages is an added advantage.

  


###### 
CORPORATE


* Understand and actively support GGGI’s mission, vision and values.
* Promote the optimum use of donor resources.
* Promote an organizational culture of trust, transparency, respect, and partnership.
* Process and share information easily.
* Manage emotions and stress positively, build rapport and resolve conflict easily.
* Promote creativity and innovation among staff.
* Be able to lead where needed and provide solutions to project-level challenges.
* Experience in a multi-cultural, international setting and ability to work independently and take initiatives in response to the organization and team’s demand.

  


###### 
ABOUT THE PROJECT



Subsequent to a call for proposal floated by Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action (BMWK), Govt. of Germany under International Climate Initiative (IKI), GGGI is implementing a project called “Asia Low-Carbon Building Transition (ALCBT)” 5 Asian countries – Cambodia, India, Indonesia, Thailand and Vietnam. The countries were chosen based on a scoping analysis to advance the building sector towards decarbonization and reducing GHG emission from the sector. The following are the broad output of the project:



* Technical and Institutional Tools: Standardized tools and systems for managing carbon emissions from building sector developed and piloted.


* Technical Capacity Building: Key industry stakeholders in project countries have enhanced capacity to deliver low carbon buildings.


* Financing: Financial pathways established to facilitate financing for occupants, owners, and developers of low carbon buildings.


* Replication and Scaling-up: Project knowledge documented and shared to facilitate replication and scaling up.



The project aims to target Policy makers (Central & Provincial Govt), Building Owners, Financial Institutions & ESCOs and Universities/Academia as beneficiary to advance Low-Carbon building transition of the countries. GGGI is looking for a Senior Officer, Regional Project Coordination to provide overall technical and coordination management support to the Project Manager in this 5-year project.

  



*Child protection – GGGI is committed to child protection, irrespective of whether any specific area of work involves direct contact with children. GGGI’s Child Protection Policy is written in accordance with the Convention on the Rights of the Child.*

title: IT Support
description:
**1st / 2nd level IT Supporter,** **Vaishnavi Tech Park Bengaluru India**

  


We are looking for an experienced IT Supporter with a natural service mindset and friendly personality.


We are expanding our in-house IT support team with an ambitious and development-oriented 1st / 2nd level IT.


The primary function as our new IT Supporter is to help to ensure that our IN organization is supported in every way regarding our internal, as well as external, employee’s use of IT Systems and IT equipment.


This entails installation and configuration of PCs, smart phones, and workstations in general and support in setting up accesses.

  


**IT Support work tasks:**


* Handling/solving tickets.


* Installation and configurations of PC’s and printers


* Employee support / Coaching in usage


* Windows administration


* Server administration


* Network administration


* Follow-ups

  


You will be the only onsite support in the office (Bengaluru) and have the responsibility for the operational status of the local IT environment but will have a close cooperation with the IT support team who works out of Poland, Ireland & Denmark.


Moreover, the employee may from time till time be allocated in shorter periods (1 – 5 days) not more than 1-2 times a year if any to give onsite support at our other subsidiaries around in Europe.


We are looking for someone with experience from a similar role and size of employee platform, who is used to navigate with and in a ticket system. The qualifying profile is updated within modern technology and IT equipment in general.

  


**Professional requirements:**


* It is important to have flair for IT and thrive in always providing an outstanding service.


* Strong understanding of IT infrastructure e.g., servers and network.


* 3-5 years in similar role and size of people-platform to give service to.


* IT experience: Microsoft, Android, Apple/iOS, Samsung, Azure active directory/M365, Windows servers etc.


* Documentation discipline


* Fluent in English in writing and speech

  


To reach the targets, we are looking for an outgoing and service minded personality who is eager but patient. You want to find the best solution, are detail oriented, independent and take initiative. You take responsibility for the assignment that has been given and are a good team player.

  


**emagine Group** supplies senior consultants and specialists with sector-specific knowledge within finance, energy, telecommunication, transportation and much more.

  


**We have a flat organizational structure** where the tone is informal, and the form of cooperation is characterized by flexibility, trust, and helpfulness. You will be given the opportunity to work independently, but also in cooperation with friendly and committed colleagues. As a group we are close, and we conduct many social activities, international strategy tour traveling.

  


**We are very proud** of our teams and combination of employees. We value diversity and appreciate sharing knowledge across the organization, so we can grow professionally and privately. We hire people with passion and engagement that are motivated and strong minded to contribute to our values and diplomatic culture.


  
**Application due**
3/31/2024  


**Start date**
Start as soon as possible  


**Workplace**
India  


**Homepage**
https://emagine.org/  


**Contact**
===========


Maja Masztalerz
HR Business Partner

Mathias Gatz

title: Customer Service Analyst
description:
**General Overview:**

Schneider Electric is in the process of building our EcoStruxure capabilities and looking for talent with a passion for helping Schneider Electric achieve its broader Digitization goals. The Connected Service Hub is one of the pillars of Digital Services Execution and a key resource in delivering added value to our customers. It is a highly visible organization at the forefront of Schneider Electrics IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things) and Digitization initiatives. We are looking for a candidate who can combine their deep technical expertise and passion for customers, with the ability to leverage data to improve the performance and reliability of our customer’ solution. The main mission of a Value Analyst is to analyze new or existing offers, suggest more features to enhance offer value by taking feedback from internal and external customers, prototype new customer needs in term of offers & incubate those offers, support implementation and execution.
**Objectives**
* Customer satisfaction


* Incubate new offers


* Translate customer needs into prototypes


* Act as consultant for customized requests


* Analyze and enhance the offer value


**Responsibilities:**
* Listen to agents, CSMs and customers to translate customers (un)voiced needs into prototype


* Pilot prototypes and close the loop with marketing to industrialize or not


* Pilot new offers and other features proposed by marketing and Digital Service Menu


* Act as consultant for customized request from customers


* Act as liaison with offer management and CSH for process and tools development for new offers


* Act as the voice of the CSH along with Offer Management when defining requirements for reports, dashboards and new features


* Support CSH teams with implementation of new features/offers through training and hyper care activities


* Manage backlog of tools development for SP&C offer


* Interacts with a network of experts for advanced support of data analysis and recommendations to the customer


* Develop recommendations based on the data, creates reports and shares reports with the customer and provides direction to the customer as to actions required


* Extracts and analyzes data, runs analytics to identify trends, gap for improvement as well as sharing best practices across hubs


* Maintain SP&C Alarm Playbook and continue to expand to new products and alarms


* Interacts with customers to gain feedback on pilots, new features, gaps in current offers and provides remote troubleshooting (e.g. phone, chat, email, etc.) as needed


* Understanding of Energy Efficiency concepts and identifying opportunities to optimize energy consumptions


**SKILLS**
* Customer centric


* Strong recognized leadership


* Solid communication capabilities


* Strong team spirit & cooperation


* Ability to influence & convince


* Strong organizational skills


* Must have flexibility to respond to customer support request


* Strong technical writing and computer knowledge, fluency in Microsoft Office tools


* Superior analytical skills and high degree of proficiency working with data


* Possesses good knowledge in critical facilities /data center diagnostic skills


5 to 7 years of experience in Services sales , Business development , will be ideal.
* 2+ years of field experience as a service engineer or CSH Agent for UPS, Cooling systems, Electrical Distribution will be an added advantage


**Interfaces**
* Customers


* Marketing


* CSM/CSPM


* Country Operations


* CSH Engineers


* Dev team


**Qualifications** **General Overview:**

5 to 7 years of experience in Services sales , Business development , will be ideal.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


We are looking for a Software Engineer (Salesforce) to lead the growth of GE Electrification Software Salesforce environment in supporting Commercial IT systems and tools. You will be responsible for the design, development, implementation, and support of elegant solutions in our Salesforce platform. You will join the enterprise application engineering team to debug, resolve critical issues and improve the overall system stability and increase platform utilization across Sales, Marketing, Service, Finance, and commercial organization.  

  

The ideal candidate has a background in sales, marketing, and customer service systems, has proven success as a Salesforce developer, and has the desire to be a thought-leader on a quickly growing team.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Lead analysis, design, development, unit test and deployment on Salesforce classic and lightning platforms as part of Agile cadence.
* Work on user stories, data loads, minor/major enhancements in partnership with business and product owners.
* Work on production incident debugging, analysis, bug fixes and deployment.
* Responsible for the overall platform health, sustenance, governance, and standards adherence with a goal to reduce technical debt and 80% utilization of out of the box Salesforce features.
* Define and incorporate best-in class governance and standard practices on the platform profiles, permission sets, naming conventions, license utilization, duplicate record avoidance and business self-service features.
* Build salesforce developer and operational technical guides, patterns, and best practices to towards building/maintaining a sustainable Salesforce platform.
* As platform consultant on various projects through successful implementation

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding or equivalent work/technical experience.
* 4-5 years' experience as a Salesforce Developer in Sales and Service Cloud.
* 3+ years of experience with HTML/CSS/JAVASCRIPT for LWC
* Experience working on development of Sales Cloud instances for mid-market or enterprise size companies.
* Strong proficiency with Force.com Platform skills (Apex, Lightning (LWC, Aura), SOQL, Unit Testing, Visualforce, Flows, Triggers)
* Experience with Salesforce sites and Communities.
* Experience integrating Salesforce with external systems (REST & SOAP API, JSON, etc.)
* Experience using Apex Data loader.
* Knowledge of Salesforce platform best practices, design guidelines and governor limits
* Experience using CI/CD Flosum tool.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Salesforce Platform Developer I certification and Salesforce Admin certification
* Working towards System Architect certification
* Experience working on integrations with (e.g., Marketo, Outreach, LeanData, ERP, Pramata, Flexera, Oracle CPQ)
* Desire for continuous learning and certification in new tools
* Excellent communication, documentation, and organizational skills.
* Has experience defining Salesforce Org. Best practices, Governances, Industry Standards and being an evangelist and adherence champion.
* Second shift in IST time zone.

**Business Acumen:**

* Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems.
* Skilled in breaking down problems, documenting problem statements and estimating efforts.
* Ability to analyze impact of technology choices.
* Skilled in negotiation to align stakeholders and communicate a single synthesized perspective to the scrum team.

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Sales Manager
description:
Reference Code: MHC-2024-09
  

Job Title: **Corporate Sales Manager - Mumbai**
  

Category: Recruitment/Executive Search Industry
  

Job Description: - Empanel New / Interested Client Prospects.
  

- Maintain relationships with existing Clients
  

- Take requirement from inactive clients.
  

- Research on the current market analysis and Tap new clients through varied sources.
  

- Responsible for ensuring Partners are trained and receive the required material to properly represent Morpheus.
  

- Client Meetings
  

- Ability to discuss strategic and sensitive issues
  

- Understand Client’s needs
  

- Maintain the Business Development database
  

- Follow up strong leads and add value to ongoing discussions with a prospect
  

- Lead negotiations and overcome objections for deal closure
  

- Ensure there is an Agreement / Contract signed with the client.
  

- Ensure Agreements are saved in soft copy format on the Server and hard copy is filed.
  

Key Skills: TEAM SPIRIT  

Degree to which employee works co-operatively with others to achieve organizational goals.  

  

PROMPT ACTION & OWNERSHIP  

Degree to which the Employee takes prompt and appropriate action and assumes the responsibility  

  

CLEAR COMMUNICATION  

Degree to which the employee communicates in a clear, concise and fluent manner both verbally and in writing to facilitate the attainment of WIGs  

  

SERVICE STANDARD  

Provides high quality standards including business conduct and work presentation to ensure a satisfactory output.  

  

Mandatory : B2B Corporate Sales Experience  

  

Gender: Female  

  

Working Days: 5 (Alt Saturdays)  

  

Timing: 10 am to 7 pm  

  

Location: Swastik Chambers, Mumbai  

  

About Morpheus Consulting:  

  

Morpheus Consulting understands the dynamics attached to talent acquisition, relationship management and the required service levels within the regional industry. Our heritage is now our main strength as we continue to work within our core markets to deliver key account management and strong contingency recruitment practices to our clients and candidates.  

  

Recruitment is a people-focused business – our success and growth are reliant upon our people. Our team of 130 consultants based in Middle east, Asia and Africa offer a blend of international recruitment experience, coupled with a platform of local market and industry knowledge. Morpheus Consulting has its presence since 2007 and has established itself as a reputed recruitment specialist in its industry.  

  

With footprints in Asia, Africa and the Middle East, we offer professional and bespoke contingency and retained search services across a variety of industrial sectors. This vast experience, industry expertise and knowledge enables our consultants to identify and present the highest quality candidates to our clients, in line with their business objectives and culture. We have built our brand by investing in people, whether it is our own consultants, candidates, or clients. This core value is central to our success, which underpins everything we do, and in return has translated into a successful and established Morpheus Consulting brand that our clients and candidates can trust.  

  

If the screening team decides that you are competent enough for the demands of the position, you will be shortlisted and invited to an interview for further consideration. If you were not shortlisted, we will keep your resume in our database for future reference. We will not be able to contact you back in this case due to the large amount of applications we receive. So if you don’t hear from us within 3 days, you can assume that your application was not successful at this time.
  

Location:
  

Required Experience: 2-12 yrs
  

Positions: 2

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


We are looking for a Software Engineer (Salesforce) to lead the growth of GE Electrification Software Salesforce environment in supporting Commercial IT systems and tools. You will be responsible for the design, development, implementation, and support of elegant solutions in our Salesforce platform. You will join the enterprise application engineering team to debug, resolve critical issues and improve the overall system stability and increase platform utilization across Sales, Marketing, Service, Finance, and commercial organization.  

  

The ideal candidate has a background in sales, marketing, and customer service systems, has proven success as a Salesforce developer, and has the desire to be a thought-leader on a quickly growing team.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Lead analysis, design, development, unit test and deployment on Salesforce classic and lightning platforms as part of Agile cadence.
* Work on user stories, data loads, minor/major enhancements in partnership with business and product owners.
* Work on production incident debugging, analysis, bug fixes and deployment.
* Responsible for the overall platform health, sustenance, governance, and standards adherence with a goal to reduce technical debt and 80% utilization of out of the box Salesforce features.
* Define and incorporate best-in class governance and standard practices on the platform profiles, permission sets, naming conventions, license utilization, duplicate record avoidance and business self-service features.
* Build salesforce developer and operational technical guides, patterns, and best practices to towards building/maintaining a sustainable Salesforce platform.
* As platform consultant on various projects through successful implementation

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding or equivalent work/technical experience.
* 4-5 years' experience as a Salesforce Developer in Sales and Service Cloud.
* 3+ years of experience with HTML/CSS/JAVASCRIPT for LWC
* Experience working on development of Sales Cloud instances for mid-market or enterprise size companies.
* Strong proficiency with Force.com Platform skills (Apex, Lightning (LWC, Aura), SOQL, Unit Testing, Visualforce, Flows, Triggers)
* Experience with Salesforce sites and Communities.
* Experience integrating Salesforce with external systems (REST & SOAP API, JSON, etc.)
* Experience using Apex Data loader.
* Knowledge of Salesforce platform best practices, design guidelines and governor limits
* Experience using CI/CD Flosum tool.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Salesforce Platform Developer I certification and Salesforce Admin certification
* Working towards System Architect certification
* Experience working on integrations with (e.g., Marketo, Outreach, LeanData, ERP, Pramata, Flexera, Oracle CPQ)
* Desire for continuous learning and certification in new tools
* Excellent communication, documentation, and organizational skills.
* Has experience defining Salesforce Org. Best practices, Governances, Industry Standards and being an evangelist and adherence champion.
* Second shift in IST time zone.

**Business Acumen:**

* Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems.
* Skilled in breaking down problems, documenting problem statements and estimating efforts.
* Ability to analyze impact of technology choices.
* Skilled in negotiation to align stakeholders and communicate a single synthesized perspective to the scrum team.

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Consultant- H/f/x
description:
**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Take part in consulting missions related to the Group's Transformation by ensuring the quality, respect of deadlines and the ethics of the consulting teams, under the supervision of a mission learder,
* Prepare and lead workshops and meetings using relevant and results-oriented consulting techniques,
* Analyze and make recommendations to change practices and organizations by defining appropriate and sustainable targets,
* Ensure change management and a good relationship with our internal customers,
* Contribute to the development of CTF's activity by taking part in internal initiatives and projects,
* Facilitate knowledge sharing and team spirit within the CTF team and with SG Consulting and Transformation.
**Profile required**
--------------------


* 5 years of higher education: Engineering or Business School, MBA,
* 2 to 5 years of consultancy experience: management consulting, strategy consulting, audit, or inspection,
* Very good effective communication, with a proven ability to communicate with senior stakeholders,
* Advanced level of English (written and spoken), French is a plus,
* Advanced skills of MS Office (Excel / Word & PowerPoint),
* Excellent client interaction skills, collaborative work style, strong interpersonal and team skills,
* Result oriented, high flexibility and work autonomy,
* Strong analytical and organizational skills,
* High ethical standards and integrity.
* Banking experience is a plus.
**Why join us**
---------------


We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.


**Business insight**
--------------------


At Société Générale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of


tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.


Whether you’re joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have


a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.


If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a


daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!


Still hesitating?


You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during


their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional


integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices and sharing their skills with


charities. There are many ways to get involved.


We are an **equal opportunities employer** and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and **promoting all talents**, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Role:** Consultant Job Location: Greater Noida Required Skills: The ServiceNow Functional Analyst will support the implementation from proposal to delivery. Includes developing a thorough understanding of the client’s requirements then applying industry best practices and detailed knowledge of ServiceNow to design an optimal solution which supports the business process meeting or exceeding the functional requirements. Builds a trusting relationship with major project stakeholders and leads them to adoption of the best solution. Supports organizational change management (OCM) efforts by providing information on the “to be” solution.
  
  

Leads quality management reviews and ensures all business and design requirements are met. Conducts application and implemented business processes demonstrations to stakeholders; may support preparation of training material and provide user training. The ServiceNow Fuctional Analyst will work closely with the Solution/Technical Architect to ensure the solution is technically feasible and to identify areas to reduce implementation efforts. Validates the configuration of business data and supports the technical team for any required custom development.
  
  

Assist or lead test plan development and execution including conducting user acceptance testing ensuring implementation meets client’s requirements. • Apply knowledge of ServiceNow to design solutions that meet or exceed requirements, support the technical team. • Build trusting relationships with project stakeholders. • Work closely with the ServiceNow Architect, identify ways to reduce implementation efforts.
  
  

* Ensure all business and design requirements are met. • Lead quality management reviews. • Support test plan development and Organizational Change Management (OCM) efforts. • Take accountability for ensuring quality solutions are developed and deployed.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Job requisition ID :: 64386
Date: Mar 4, 2024
Location: Bengaluru
Designation: Consultant
Entity:
**What impact will you make?**

  

Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. As the undisputed leader in professional services, Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential

  

**Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.**

  


**The Team**

  

Deloitte helps organizations evaluate and manage the risks associated with third parties (outsourcers, licensees, alliances, suppliers), maximizing the performance of the extended enterprise and achieving strategic business objectives; optimizing IT costs and limiting operational, financial, and legal risk related to the ownership and use of software, through point-in-time solutions and ongoing managed service solutions.

  



**Work you’ll do**

  

As a part of our Risk Advisory team, you’ll build and nurture positive working relationships with teams and clients with the intention to exceed client expectations. You’ll:

  

**Role Description –**

  

* Lead and execute in-depth third-party risk assessments, aligned with ISMS, NIST or similar information security principles, for clients, meticulously identifying potential vulnerabilities and threats within their vendor ecosystem.
* Collaborate closely with clients and multidisciplinary teams, including compliance, auditing, and regulatory experts, while leveraging performance analytics and risk analytics, to design and implement tailored risk management programs that align with business objectives.
* Conduct risk assessments and audits covering people, processes, and technology, identifying gaps, risks, opportunities, and areas for improvement within policies, procedures, and standards of the vendor ecosystem.
* Develop and implement tailored risk mitigation strategies and action plans in collaboration with client teams, addressing specific control frameworks for third-party risk management.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate third-party vendor performance against customized risk and compliance metrics, providing timely insights, recommendations, and documented observations.
* Execute third-party compliance and assurance initiatives, including due diligence, on-site audits, and contractual compliance audits, following industry best practices.
* Engage in advanced contract analytics to optimize contracts and streamline processes.
* Document information security risks, recommendations, and compensating controls in comprehensive assessment and audit reports, focusing on risks associated with third-party relationships.
* Deliver insightful risk assessment reports to clients' senior leadership, facilitating informed decision-making and proactive risk management.

  


**Qualifications**

  


* A Bachelor's degree in Information Security, or a related field from a reputable institution. Advanced degrees and relevant certifications are highly advantageous.
* Proven expertise in third-party risk management, vendor assessments, ISMS, or related areas, with a track record of successful client engagement and risk mitigation.
* Deep knowledge of information security principles, Data Protection & Privacy regulations, and relevant control frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, GDPR) as they pertain to third-party risk management.
* Strong ability to liaise effectively with clients, manage stakeholder expectations, and collaborate seamlessly across departments and disciplines.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, for articulating complex concepts and recommendations to diverse audiences.
* Detail-oriented organizational skills, essential for managing multiple client engagements and delivering high-quality results.
* Recognized certifications such as the Certified Third-Party Risk Professional (CTPRP), Certified Third Party Risk Assessor (CTPRA), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), ISO27001, or ISO 22301 certifications are advantageous.
* Proficiency in utilizing modern risk management tools (Example: ServiceNow, Archer, OneTrust, Coupa etc.) and platforms to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of client deliverables.

  




**How you’ll grow**

  

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help build world-class skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career

title: Business Consultant
description:
Job Description : Strategy Planning and Performance Consultant  

  

Thryve Digital Health LLP is an emerging global healthcare partner that delivers strategic innovation, expertise, and flexibility to its healthcare partners. Being a US healthcare conglomerate captive, we have direct access to deeper insights that help us accelerate our learning process and keeps us ahead of the curve. Thryve delivers next-generation solutions that enable our healthcare partners to provide positive experiences to their consumers.  

  

Our global collaborative of healthcare, operations, and IT experts creates innovative and sustainable processes for our clients, which keeps the ever-evolving consumers engaged and assists them in managing the future of their healthcare better. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. Thryve is an equal opportunity employer and places a high value on integrity, diversity, and inclusion in the organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. For more information about the organization, please visit www.thryvedigital.com  

  

Role Summary  

  

As a Strategy Planning and Performance Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in a fast-paced and client-driven environment, collaborating closely with partners to manage strategic initiatives, manage administrative tasks, and develop innovative solutions to meet client needs. Responsibilities may include tracking strategic initiatives, managing meetings, preparing reports, and facilitating communication between various teams. You may also be involved in project management, handling confidential information, and assisting in strategic planning. Strong organizational and communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask are crucial for this role. Adaptability and discretion are key attributes as well.  

  

Responsibilities  

  

* Build, maintain, and evolve external relationships with partners and across the ecosystem, and manage strategic partnerships with entities of all sizes
* Develop cross-product area strategic partner initiatives and build go-to-market strategies to meet broader Google goals across rapidly changing industries
* Ideate and drive complex deals with potential partners and renewals/expansions for existing partners and build consensus with internal and external executives
* Serve as the relationship manager for our current existing agreements
* Help realize and optimize value from these partnerships while building effective long-term relationships
* Driving the implementation of new digital tools and leading the change initiatives required.
* Championing the use of digital tools in the firm
* Bringing innovation and new ideas to improve ways of working
* Providing strategic oversight to technical digital projects
* Supervising the implementation of learning and development initiatives
* Managing the local execution of global projects
* Collaborating with local, regional and global teams to drive project execution
* Manage and organize strategic data, reports, and documentation for easy accessibility.
* Identify potential risks and challenges associated with strategic initiatives and work on mitigation strategies.
* Identify areas for improvement in processes and contribute to the enhancement of strategic planning methodologies.
* Assist in budget preparation and tracking for strategic projects, ensuring financial considerations align with goals.
* Handle sensitive information related to strategic initiatives with the utmost confidentiality.
* Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact of strategic initiatives.

  

Requirements & Qualifications  

  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
* Experience: 2 plus years’ experience in driving strategic initiatives for Organizational change and Talent Management
* Proficiency: Social media platforms, CRM, Project Management, Calendar software, Office Suite
* Experience working with C-level executives and cross-functionally across all levels of management.
* Skills: Excellent communication, writing, editing, strong email etiquette, professionalism
  

#### **Short Info**


Posted: 2 day(s) ago
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience: 6 Years To 9 Years

title: Business Analyst
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **Job Summary:**

**Talent Services (TS)** is a core service function within the Global Delivery Services – Enablement Services organization, providing multiple Talent Portfolio support services including Talent Enablement and Operations, Talent Attraction and Acquisition support, Onboarding support, Talent Reporting, Talent Rewards, Learning Administration, DE&I, Global Mobility, Workforce Management and Performance Management support to EY member firms. TS provides services to country, region, area, Talent executive and other EY stakeholders across the globe. These services are delivered from our centres in Dalian, China; Trivandrum, Kochi and Bangalore, India; Wroclaw, Poland; and Manila, Philippines. TS teams deliver consistent, high-quality and operationally efficient Talent Programs and Portfolio support services to EY through a globally efficient and effective network of GDS centres.

 **Digital Insights**, Provides strategic people reporting, analysis, predictive analytics, and workforce planning capabilities to enable EY to make informed, evidence based, commercial decisions to drive business value. Establishes overall organisation effectiveness and value across EY with real time process embedded insights to increase accountability and transparency while delivering at scale.

 **Virtual Talent Hub (VTH)** is an extended delivery model for high quality skills and specialism. **Reporting VTH** serves to support the preparation and review of complex People reports and analysis of Talent metrics and results. The function caters to the design and development of complex reports and custom dashboards to user specifications as well as contributes to special projects related to Area/ Region/ SL measurement strategy.

 **US Talent Enablement Center (TEC)** is a team that delivers highly specialized solutions for US Talent functions across project management, visa & immigration, accommodations, analytics, policy and operations. Providing the highest quality support with a focus on managing risk to the firm. TEC centralizes and enables consistency across multiple functions for the regions, service lines, national practices and Centers of Excellence.

 **VTH HR Business Analyst** role seeks data analysis and analytics professional with a specific focus on, data investigation, predictive modelling, and data visualizations to deliver strategic insights to decision makers. The person in this role requires strong client relationships with senior talent leaders. This is an important position requiring both business awareness and technical knowledge, providing challenging opportunities for motivated individuals to contribute to the direction of achieving our strategic ambitions.

 **Essential Functions of the Job:**


The key function of this position is to

* Consult with our senior talent leadership in the United States to understand their strategic imperatives. Provide exceptional service by being connected, responsive and Insightful. Understand their needs and business questions to determine the right approach for analysis and what to deliver.
* Maintain strong business relationships with key stakeholders (including the Talent Enablement Center and VTH), Talent Leaders, Strategic Talent Consultants, Digital Talent Reporting and Analytics team, etc.) to keep on the pulse of what is important to leadership and build relevant analysis and interpretation.
* Establish credibility by demonstrating an understanding and keeping current on Talent Analytic trends, research and tools. Generates innovative ideas to employ in deliverables.
* Independently drive the successful delivery of projects and products using strong project management and deployment focused activities.
* Analyze and clearly present data and other information to identify significant trends or key issues, provides recommendations based on key trends and forecasts.
* Able to deliver clear and concise verbal or written messages that facilitate a mutual understanding in both parties. Able to communicate complicated data and analytics simply and clearly.
* Produce analysis and visualizations through cutting edge technologies such as PowerBI.
* Generate innovative ideas and solutions that improve products, insights and our ability to efficiently deliver.
* Support global and local workforce planning processes by facilitating planning activities, communications, and escalations
* Meet recurring and ad hoc analytic needs to drive evidence based decision making and action


.

**Key Objectives of the Role:**

* Good business acumen – ability to understand data analytics landscape and to consider the functionality and integration requirements in line with the analytical and reporting capabilities required to implement strategic priorities.
* Proactive consulting skills that drive business impact; able to interpret business requirements and, where prioritized, co-create the most relevant & pragmatic approach
* Knowledge of data analytics and visualization tools and well versed with related market trends, leading practices, services, and solutions.
* Ability to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously, resource requirements and meet deadlines
* Strong hold on project management skills to focus on deliverables with agility
* Good to be familiar with statistical techniques
* Ability to participate effectively in virtual teams and networks across diverse and dispersed geographies.
* Strong teaming skills; collaborate effectively across talent ecosystem, within the digital team and the firm at-large.
* Strong communication skills for sharing thought leadership.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail - the ability to operate within budget and effective time frames.
* Strong research and analytical skills to track and interpret trending directions for data analytics and to identify potential future options.
* Strong writing and communication skills. Can we say English language?
* Ability to cope with ambiguity; to drive change and performance outcomes in a complex and agile environment.
* Develop high level familiarity with existing EY Reports, Dashboards, and other analytic tools, promoting the use of existing resources before developing new.

 **Knowledge and Skills Requirements:**

* Possess high proficiency in **Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, SharePoint, etc.).** Proficiency with MS Power Platform highly desirable
* Possess a global mindset with the ability to work virtually across multiple countries, time zones and cultures, leveraging different technologies.
* Have strong numeracy and analytical skills to grasp complexities and identify relationships among data via data modelling, ability to address problems and issues through data cleansing and organization
* Knowledgeable on Data Science, Data Integration, Data Visualization and Data Analytics concepts and workings
* Knowledge of **Visual Basic (VBA) scripts and Macro** development highly desirable
* Good operational experience or knowledge with HR processes and systems related to workforce reporting, recruiting, learning, performance management and overall people data
* Extensive reporting experience including knowledge of process and data usage. Knowledge of standard metrics and key performance indicators
* Strong design aesthetic and visualization skills, Expertise in providing in depth HR data insights using Excel and visualisation tools such as Power BI.
* Strong experience with developing actionable management dashboards for HR or Talent organizations.

  

**Other Technical Requirements:**

* Proficiency with HR Technology (PeopleSoft, Success Factors, Workday and/or Taleo a plus)
* Proficiency with Business Intelligence tools

 **Job Requirements:**

**Education:**

* Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Commerce, Business Administration, Human Resources, Mathematics, Statistics or related discipline required.
* Diploma in Talent Analytics will be an added advantage

 **Experience:**

* 6-8 + years or more of professional experience working in HR Services – Data Analyst/ Reporting or Operations domain

 **Certification Requirements:**

* PMP, Agile certifications desirable

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  



EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  



Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Instrumentation Engineer
description:
**Division**
------------


Manufacturing**Department**
--------------


Formulation**Sub Department 1**
--------------------


Engineering - Formulation**Job Purpose**
---------------



The incumbent is a team member of â€œ Unit Engineering Maintenance & Reliability Team and carries overall responsibility to:  

1.Execute the maintenance activities in the plant & ensure the minimum Instrumentation & Automation breakdown with maximum efficiency by following safety & GMP Standards  

2.Support EM & R Senior Instrumentation Engineer in carrying out Functional EM&R Planning, Detailed Scheduling and Execution of CMP to- ensure continuity of availability of plant & equipment at optimal cost; achieve standard capacity; ensure overall plant & equipment integrity & reliability - in compliance with Cipla Policies, Standards & Procedures; Reporting of EM&R MIS, Incidents & Deviations @ SOP;  

Instrumentation Engineer is responsible for executing maintenance tasks as assigned by Senior Engineer for his function in the Manufacturing & Packing Area.  

Where outsourced, 3rd Party Instrumentation Engineer is accountable for the Service Floor / Technical Floor maintenance execution

**Key Accountabilities (1/6)**
------------------------------



I. Shift Maintenance Activity: Execute maintenance activities in a shift by managing available resources to achieve shift maintenance plan.  

Â¢ Execute assigned tasks as per planned Instrumentation & Automation maintenance activity to meet maintenance targets for a shift  

Â¢ Cater to machine maintenance requirements of Unit as a responsible member of the team with overall ownership of Unit Operations.  

Â¢ Increase the efficiency of area by ensuring better utilization of equipment and by reducing downtime in manufacturing area  

Â¢ Prepare and submit Instrumentation shift engineer report to ensure smooth shift handover  

II. Comprehensive Maintenance Plan Execution: Give inputs for preparing & adhere to unique planner for planned preventive maintenance & instrument calibrations for effective maintenance and adherence to standards.  

Â¢ Schedule shift activities in line with the CMP including PM, Calibration, and condition monitoring activities.  

Â¢ Execute planned Instrumentation & Automation maintenance and update related documentation  

o Preventive Maintenance  

o Calibration  

o Condition Monitoring  

o Planned Corrective Actions  

Â¢ Follow good Engineering practices during planned preventive activity.  

Â¢ Perform validation, qualification and calibration as per schedule and update output of all activities in the systems  

Â¢ Prepare new documents and update existing documents as per GMP requirement  

Â¢ Update Metrics on Schedule compliance  

III. Breakdown Maintenance: Handle breakdown maintenance to avoid recurrence and maintain continuous process operations  

Â¢ Execute Instrumentation & Automation breakdown work expeditiously but safely and in compliance with cGMP.  

Â¢ Receipt and tracking the job card for the break down activity  

Â¢ Maintain critical Instrumentation & Automation spares inventory of all machines to reduce resolution time

**Key Accountabilities (2/6)**
------------------------------



IV. Efficient Equipment Operation: Operate the equipment efficiently without error and deviation as per SOP to meet shift targets  

Â¢ Operate an equipment only when trained and authorized to do it.  

Â¢ Perform unit operations as per SOP & unit processes as per work instructions  

Â¢ Maintain equipment, facility and block premises as per SOP for audit readiness. Ensure equipment, facility and block premises are maintained as per regulatory compliance  

Â¢ Ensure all operations are performed as per GMP & Safety norms by reviewing all processes and documents for compliance  

Â¢ Maintain system integrity by updating documentations and deviations on CipDox while performing operations  

V. New Technology / Capex: Use new technologies initiated by Management while adhering to CAPEX and OPEX targets to improve Machine/system performance  

Â¢ Implement new technologies in the plant initiated by management  

Â¢ Attend planned trainings and incorporate the learnings on the floor for improving machine performance  

Â¢ Implement and close ideas generated through internal audits / Idea generation sessions  

Â¢ Monitor present energy use of the plants to identify and report areas for energy conservation  

Â¢ Implement Energy Conservation activities to improve the equipment efficiency, reduce error and reduce production cost  

Â¢ Identify areas of improvement in instrumentation functoin for waste & work simplification  

Â¢ Manage activities to operate within budget and to reduce operating expenses  

Â¢ Verification of the contract invoices and making of the job orders as per estimates  

VI. Spares Management: Perform Material and Spare management and issue Consumables, spares, materials, log books etc. to avoid delays due to unavailability of materials  

Â¢ Issue required Instrumentation & Automation materials (spares and consumables) to the contractors from stores and make SAP entries for the receipts and issuance  

Â¢ Maintain the inventory of critical spares and consumables by tracking consumption and monitoring of stocks  

Â¢ Assess log book requirements, raise the request to QA and issue them within required timelines  

Â¢ Classify the unused / spare / usable scrap materials or components and reuse the same where ever possible

**Key Accountabilities (3/6)**
------------------------------



VII. EHS Compliance: maintain high level of Safety during maintenance to avoid major breakdown and report accidents/ incidences  

Â¢ Complete preplacement Safety Training before starting the work in any area.  

Â¢ Monitor safe operations of the machine as per SOP and timely report any safety deviations  

Â¢ Maintain proper procedures for safety permits in plant Ensure safety systems and procedures followed by the operators in the shift  

Â¢ Issue work permits to contractual staff after verifying the safety aspects, monitoring and communicating safety hazards and safety near miss to the concern.  

Â¢ Ensure availability and usage of PPEs in the shift by coordinating with EHS department for requirements and shift schedule; Ensure usage and maintenance of PPEs by self & other workmen during shifts  

Â¢ Report any safety incident to the Shift In charge as well as the Senior Engineer for the following  

o Near Miss  

o Safety Incident  

o Work Place Inspection  

o Unsafe Act  

o Unsafe Condition  

Â¢ Attend safety meetings and ensure implementation of actions planned during departmental safety meeting at shop floor  

Â¢ Ensure compliances to safety training targets by monthly reconciling attendance records  

VIII. cGMP Compliance: Execute and update online documentation to meet cGMP requirements  

Â¢ Complete preplacement cGMP Training before starting the work in any area.  

Â¢ Monitor cGMP compliance in the impact domain and report any incident / cGMP deviation to the Shift In charge as well as the Senior Engineer.  

Â¢ Maintain online instrumentation documentation and timely entries in all documents in cGMP environment and their supporting documents  

Â¢ Check documentation before submission to ensure data integrity. In case of any deficiency or errors in documents and rectify them as per SOP  

Â¢ Conduct training related to cGMP, equipment operation, safety and housekeeping for workmen  

Â¢ Optimize the use of resources in housekeeping; Ensure good housekeeping and sanitisation as per the guidelines  

Â¢ Operate software such as SAP, CipDox and QMS as required and basis training & certification.  

Â¢ Execute CAPA as guided by the Instrumentation Senior Engineer.  

Â¢ Prepare and maintain engineering documents wrt cGMP and Good Engineering Practices

**Key Accountabilities (4/6)**
------------------------------



IX. Continuous Improvements: Provide suggestions for optimization of processes to manufacture quality product  

Â¢ Propose and implement new idea to enhance production, optimise the use of consumable goods and maximum utilization of resources  

Â¢ Provide new ideas and simplify processes to reduce process cycle time and achieve new targets  

Â¢ Participate in internal audits / Idea generation sessions to improve on deficiencies to verify GEP and GMP.  

Â¢ Implement action plans for improving on deficiencies observed through internal / external audits  

X. [E] Self Development on functional & leadership aspects  

Â¢ Keep self-updated on regulatory guidelines and product regulatory requirements of all markets to which product manufactured by the Site is exported.  

Â¢ Undergo training on Functional & Leadership capability building as per guidance from HR function and the Global Operations Team.

**Key Accountabilities (5/6)**
------------------------------


**Key Accountabilities (6/6)**
------------------------------


**Major Challenges**
--------------------


* CapEx and OpEx â€œ Adherence to the budget
* Cost vs performance trade off in equipment
* Ageing Asset leading to escalating OpEx Cost
* Challenges around capability & competence of personnel and service providers

--------------------------

Â¢ Central purchase for provide Technical inputs and clarifications for CAPEX
